tophersmith.security.headers.csp.directives

Class AbstractUnsafeDirective

  • java.lang.Object
    • tophersmith.security.headers.csp.directives.AbstractCSPDirective
      • tophersmith.security.headers.csp.directives.AbstractSrcDirective
        • tophersmith.security.headers.csp.directives.AbstractUnsafeDirective
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ScriptSrcDirective, StyleSrcDirective

    public abstract class AbstractUnsafeDirective
extends AbstractSrcDirective
    The AbstractUnsafeDirective is a base class for script-src and style-src that uses the 'unsafe-inline' or 'unsafe-eval' which also use the nonce and hash source values.
    Author:
    Chris Smith

    • Method Detail

      • addNewHash

        protected void addNewHash(String type,
              String b64hash)
        adds a hash value to this directive
        Parameters:
        type - one of "sha256", "sha384", "sha512"
        b64hash - a base64 hash value

      • resetHashes

        public void resetHashes()
        removes all hashes from this directive

      • addNewNonce

        protected void addNewNonce(String nonce)
        adds a nonce value to this directive
        Parameters:
        nonce - a randomly generated value from generateNonce(int)

      • generateNonce

        public static String generateNonce(int size)
        construct a secure alphanumeric nonce string
        Parameters:
        size - the string length. This value will be set to the nearest multiple of 4
        Returns:
        an alphanumeric string of length size

      • resetNonces

        public void resetNonces()
        removes all nonces from this directive

      • isValidKeyword

        protected boolean isValidKeyword(String val)
        test whether this directive value is a Keyword
        Overrides:
        isValidKeyword in class AbstractCSPDirective
        Parameters:
        val - a directive value to validate
        Returns:
        true if val is one of 'unsafe-eval' 'unsafe-inline' or starts with 'nonce

      • validateHashes

        protected void validateHashes(CSPValidationReport report)
        test whether this directive value contains valid hashes
        Parameters:
        report - a validation report to hold any issues discovered

      • validateNonces

        protected void validateNonces(CSPValidationReport report)
        test whether this directive value contains valid nonces
        Parameters:
        report - a validation report to hold any issues discovered

      • buildDirectiveValue

        protected String buildDirectiveValue()
        builds the nonce and hash values if set
        Overrides:
        buildDirectiveValue in class AbstractCSPDirective
        Returns:
        a string containing all nonces and hashes, or empty

      • validateAndReport

        public void validateAndReport(CSPValidationReport report)
        For this Unsafe-style Directive, validate according to AbstractSrcDirective.validateAndReport(CSPValidationReport) also validate the hashes and nonces
        Overrides:
        validateAndReport in class AbstractSrcDirective
        Parameters:
        report - a validation report to hold any issues discovered
